bug.author: ghost(ghost)
bug.summary: Config parser doesn't understand docker registries with port numbers
bug.description:
My private docker registry is exposed on a port number other than 443/80, e.g. registry.foobar.com:4567. It seems that Polyaxon's config parser assumes that the presence of a colon always means the end of the registry endpoint + docker image name and the start of the docker image tag. This is not always the case. To reproduce, simply point Polyaxon to a docker registry which is exposed with a port number rather than plain 80/443-exposed. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behaviour</denchmark-h>
Polyaxon should use a smarter regex to parse docker images. Perhaps a better assumption to make would be that the last colon in the string is what separates the registry + image name and the tag. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
Any/all environments <denchmark-h:h3>Error</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>{'_schema': ['Invalid docker image registry.foobar.com:4567/my/docker/image:latestâ€™]} </denchmark-code>
